Okay... We've talked about this before.... OMG... I want to go... If 
anyone is serious enough to go next year, count me in...

The site is in Japanese and YES babelfish is our friend for now.. If 
you want to see this great tour... 

http://rau.milkcafe.to/makoto/book/tour_1.htm

The tour starts with the Ishin shishi sites, the Restoration mansion 
(yeah what did you expect! just kidding). 

Click next at the bottom

This part of the tour shows the home of Katsura and Ikumatsu. If you 
remember the RK OVAs then this should look familiar... There's 
actually some sort of info (I'm not really sure as babelfish is 
weird), that the Shinsengumi attacked the place and Katsura had 
Ikumatsu hide in the big chest (don't worry you won't miss it). 
There's a picture of Ikumatsu (not far from how she was drawn in 
RK). Looks like she was also a Geisha? (not sure) 
Then there seems to be a restaurant inside the Restoration mansion? 

Oh of course the prices are there too.

Click next at the bottom

I think it mentioned that they visited the Ikeda house but I'm not 
sure about the pictures... 

There are pictures of what I'd say castles, probably the official 
headquarters in Kyoto? I'm not sure please clarify this for me. 
Thanks...

Then they leave for the good part, the Maekawa residence (where the 
Shinsengumi stayed after they separated I think from Serizawa Kamo?)
There is a shot of the corridor, shot of the house outside and a 
shot of the storehouse. The storehouse is an interesting thing 
because most tours I've read do let you go inside.

Click next 

This is inside the storehouse... The floors are removable? What for?
There's also the low ceiling and the pulley there. The webmaster 
said probably for torture... Remember RK OVA again... I think it was 
in the directors cut, a footage was shown about this. More removable 
floors... Finally what is that wood panel with the name Shinsengumi 
on it? A postcard... 

Then contact information! I REALLY WANT TO GO!

click next

Yagi residence headquarters of Shinsengumi... I think this is where 
Serizawa Kamo was forced to commit seppuku (not sure as usual... I'm 
bad at this)... Bunches of pictures of the house... PLUS Shinsengumi 
merchandise... I really want that UNIFORM... Last interesting note 
for me is the Heshou Well, it says it has been in existence while 
our bishies stayed there. I'm not sure what they meant when they 
started talking about the "stones"... More yagi residence pictures...

The tour was conducted by bus for one day, back in June 2003.

~wounds
